de: Participants will debug faulty Python code across different difficulty levels.Their goal is to identify and correct errors while ensuring the code runs correctly and efficiently.
catchy_de: Put your debugging skills to the test! Code Detox challenges you to find and fix errors in buggy Python code within a limited time. Do you have what it takes to debug like a pro?
ru:
• â— Individual event.
  • â— Participants can only fix bugs and cannot rewrite logic unless specified.
  • â— Using online resources, AI tools, or external help is prohibited.
  • â— Hardcoded solutions will be penalized.
  • â— Incorrect fixes result in negative marking.
  • â— Submitting incorrect fixes will result in negative marking.
  • â— The event uses only Python.
  • â— The participant with the maximum score within the given time duration will be declared the winner.
  • â— If two or more participants have the same score, the tie-breaker rules will apply.
  • â— The participant with the highest score wins.

de: Welcome to the ultimate stock trading challenge, where participants will compete in a high-intensity virtual trading simulation. Each trader starts with â‚¹2,00,000 in virtual capital and must strategically trade within a selected set of NIFTY 50 stocks. With only 10 trades allowed, every decision matters! Track your profits and losses in real-time as we announce updates every 30 minutes. The participant with the highest portfolio value at the end of 90 minutes wins.
catchy_de: Test your trading instincts in this fast-paced stock market simulation! With limited trades and a fixed capital, only the smartest traders will emerge victorious. Can you maximize your portfolio in 90 minutes?
ca: Stock Market | Trading Challenge | Virtual Portfolio
ru:
• â— Platform: Neostox (Participants must create accounts in advance of the event).
  • â— Team Size: Solo (1 participant per team).
  • â— Starting Capital: â‚¹2,00,000 virtual money.
  • â— Trading Scope: Only NIFTY 50 stocks (Reliance Industries, HDFC Bank, Adani Enterprises, Tata Motors, State Bank of India, Tech Mahindra).
  • â— Trade Limit: Maximum of 10 trades allowed per participant.
  • â— Trading Type: Only intraday trading at market price and fixed quantity.
  • â— Profit/Loss Updates: Interim results announced every 30 minutes.
  • â— Disqualification Criteria: Trading any stock outside the mentioned six, exceeding the 10-trade limit, or spending more than â‚¹2,00,000.
  • â— Trading Freeze: After 1 hour 30 minutes.
  • â— Ranking Criteria: Highest portfolio value at the end of the event wins.
  • â— Judging Decision: The committee's decision is final.

de: In this thrilling event, participants will tackle coding challenges where each solution reveals a hidden clue. By piecing together these clues, they will uncover the final answer. The event consists of two exciting roundsâ€”one focused on Python coding and another on cryptography. Speed, accuracy, and logical thinking are the keys to victory!
catchy_de: Crack the Code, Decipher the Clue, Chase the Answer!
ca: Unleash your coding and cryptography skills to solve the ultimate challenge!
ru:
• Round 1
  •     â— Participants must solve simple python coding challenges within the given time.
  •     â— The output of each challenge contains a hidden clue leading to the next step.
  •     â— Incorrect submissions will result in negative marking.
  •     â— Using online resources, AI tools, or external assistance is strictly prohibited.
  •     â— Timely hints will be provided.
  • Round 2
  •     â— Round 2 is pen and paper
  •     â— Participants MUST apply basic decryption techniques like Playfair cipher, Caesar Cipher, and Transposition techniques like rail fence and substitution techniques to decipher the final answer.
  • Resources:https://youtu.be/UURjVI5cw4g?si=-j4OBRzwMELicMlr
  •     https://youtu.be/JtbKh_12ctg?si=WbvOA6-nbqrQmN5N
  •     https://youtu.be/MFwgaWRyfZE?si=zyim2LBt9gk6xAZ-
  •     â— The first participant to crack the code and arrive at the correct answer wins.
  •     â— In case of a tie, tie-breaker rules will be applied.

act_ev: Developing Event - you can use AI tools
de:
This Challenge is not just another hackathon - it's a playground for coders to build, improve, test their developing skillsâ€”Yes you can also build your dev skills here by leveraging AI tools and getting help from the internet.


  • ğŸ” How It Works:
  •     â— Choose Your Domain (Front-end, Back-end, or â€œJust Workâ€ Scripts like APIs/automation).
  •     â— Unlock the Theme on event day (surprise twist!).
  •     â— Build Something Epic in 45 mins (+10 mins to explain).
  •     â— Show Off to judgesâ€”explanation matters most (40% of your score!).

  • What Makes This Event Unique?

catchy_de: Imagine a coding adventure where creativity is your only limit, and your technical skills are your superpower. Join our Dev Dash Challenge Whether youâ€™re copy-pasting your first HTML tag or debugging Kubernetes in your sleep, this is where code meets chaosâ€”and genius is born. Before you hover-out you can use AI tools click ğŸ‘‡ to know 'more'
ca: Race against the clock! Showcase your coding skills in this high-energy flash hackathon where creativity meets technical prowess.
ru:
Domains & Themes:


  • Front-End Development
  •     â— Themes: Business landing pages, chat interfaces, product display.
  •     â— Perfect for: Design enthusiasts and those who know HTML CSS(may be js).
  • Back-End Development
  •     â— Themes: RESTful APIs(for CRUD operations), real-time chat application backend, dynamic content serving.
  •     â— Perfect for: Those who know flask,springboot like frameworks(beginner level is enough)
  • Just-Working Scripts
  •     â— Themes: Web scrapers, file automation(like send a file over email, file organizing), auto file conversion handling(ppt to pdf..), API wrappers(using external apis or creating oneâ€”just a function).
  •     â— Perfect for: Those who know any basic programming language and want to implement them.

Instructions:

  • Teams:
  •     â— Up to 2 members per team. In case of an odd number.
  • Domain & Theme:
  •     â— Choose your domain in advance; theme will be assigned on event day.
  • Time:
  •     â— 45 minutes of coding plus 10 minutes for wrap-up.
  • Resources:
  •     â— Use any online resources (search engines, tutorials, AI) but understand your code. Your understanding and execution will be evaluated.
  • Equipment:
  •     â— Bring your own laptop.
  • Judging:
  •     â— Projects are judged on creativity (20%), efficiency (10%), explanation (40%), usability (20%), and domain-specific implementation (20%) => 100%.
  • Integrity:
  •     â— All work must be done during the event.
  • Conduct:
  •     â— Follow organizer instructions and maintain a respectful environment.
